---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Thanks a lot @ADedecker. Iâ€¯was misled by the fact that the T_{2.5} section of the file interrupted the T_2 section. In order to make it easier to review the changes, I used one commit to move things around and then one commit using your simplifications.

:v: PatrickMassot can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Thanks!

bors d+
linting

Thanks!

bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion letI := sInf S ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (h : âˆ€ x, motive (t2Quotient.mk x)) : motive q := Quotient.inductionOn q h ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (q : t2Quotient X) (q' : t2Quotient Y) (h : âˆ€ x y, motive (mk x) (mk y)) : motive q q' := ```

If you move this after [T2Space.of_injective_continuous](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Separation.html#T2Space.of_injective_continuous) (which I think should be higher anyway) you can do:
```suggestion
  change t2Setoid X â‰¤ Setoid.ker f
  exact sInf_le <| .of_injective_continuous
    (Setoid.ker_lift_injective _) (hf.quotient_lift fun _ _ â†¦ id)
```

If you move this after [separated_by_continuous](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Separation.html#separated_by_continuous) you can do:
```suggestion
  rw [t2Space_iff]
  rintro âŸ¨xâŸ© âŸ¨yâŸ© (h : Â¬ t2Quotient.mk x = t2Quotient.mk y)
  obtain âŸ¨s, hs, hsxyâŸ© : âˆƒ s, T2Space (Quotient s) âˆ§ Quotient.mk s x â‰  Quotient.mk s y := by
    simpa [t2Quotient.mk_eq] using h
  exact separated_by_continuous (continuous_map_sInf (by exact hs)) hsxy
```

This one is a bit less satisfying to read because the condition on open sets explicitly appear, but is what the API makes easiest.

```suggestion
    x â‰ˆ y â†” âˆ€ s âˆˆ S, s.Rel x y := Iff.rfl
```
It looks a bit ugly (maybe it would be better with `Iff.rfl` on the next line) but I think strictly speaking these are our conventions.

```suggestion
  inferInstanceAs <| TopologicalSpace (Quotient _)
```

```suggestion
  Setoid.quotient_mk_sInf_eq
```

```suggestion
  continuous_quotient_mk'
```

```suggestion
  Quotient.inductionOnâ‚‚ q q' h
```

```suggestion
  Quotient.lift_mk (s := t2Setoid X) f (t2Quotient.compatible hf) x
```

nodes.body: linting

Thanks a lot @ADedecker. Iâ€¯was misled by the fact that the T_{2.5} section of the file interrupted the T_2 section. In order to make it easier to review the changes, I used one commit to move things around and then one commit using your simplifications.

Thanks!
